definitions: artificial intelligence system trained on vast text datasets to understand and generate human-like language through deep learning
examples: The company deployed an LLM to automate customer service responses
Researchers fine-tuned the LLM on medical literature for diagnostic assistance

definitions: thinly sliced salmon preserved through salt-curing or brining without heat
oxygen in its liquid state used as rocket propellant in aerospace applications
examples: She ordered a bagel with lox and cream cheese for breakfast
The deli serves fresh lox imported from Norwegian fisheries
The rocket's tanks held tons of lox for the orbital launch
Engineers monitored the lox temperature during the fueling procedure

definitions: powerful psychedelic substance that alters perception, mood, and cognitive processes
pre-decimal British currency system using pounds, shillings, and pence as units
examples: LSD research has recently resumed for treating certain mental health conditions
The documentary explored LSD's impact on 1960s counterculture
Old accounting ledgers recorded prices in LSD before decimalization
Converting LSD to modern decimal currency requires careful calculation

definitions: Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam, a separatist militant organization formerly active in Sri Lanka
examples: The LTTE controlled significant territory during the Sri Lankan civil war
International observers documented LTTE activities throughout the conflict period

definitions: physical or mental effort expended to accomplish tasks or produce goods
collective body of workers in an economy or organization
physiological process of delivering a baby through contractions and birth
political party representing workers' interests and progressive social policies
examples: Manual labor built the infrastructure of modern cities
The project required months of intensive labor to complete
Labor negotiations resulted in improved working conditions
The company's labor force includes skilled technicians and engineers
She went into labor at midnight and delivered by morning
The midwife monitored her throughout the labor process
The Labor Party proposed universal healthcare reforms
Labor won the election with promises of workers' rights

definitions: physical or mental effort expended to accomplish tasks or produce goods
collective body of workers in an economy or organization
physiological process of delivering a baby through contractions and birth
political party representing workers' interests and progressive social policies
examples: Manual labour built the infrastructure of modern cities
The project required months of intensive labour to complete
Labour negotiations resulted in improved working conditions
The company's labour force includes skilled technicians and engineers
She went into labour at midnight and delivered by morning
The midwife monitored her throughout the labour process
The Labour Party proposed universal healthcare reforms
Labour won the election with promises of workers' rights

definitions: large retriever dog breed known for friendly temperament and water-resistant coat
mainland portion of Newfoundland and Labrador province in eastern Canada
examples: Their chocolate Labrador loves swimming in the lake
Labradors make excellent family pets and service dogs
Mining companies operate in remote areas of Labrador
The Labrador coast features dramatic cliffs and icebergs

definitions: systematic observation and recording of people, places, or activities for security, law enforcement, or research purposes
examples: Security cameras provide constant surveillance of the building entrance
Government surveillance programs raised privacy concerns among citizens

definitions: systematic gathering of information from individuals through questions or observations
detailed measurement and mapping of land boundaries and features
thorough examination or assessment of a situation, building, or subject area
examples: The customer satisfaction survey revealed service improvement opportunities
Researchers conducted surveys to understand voting preferences
The property survey identified the exact boundary lines
Engineers completed a topographical survey before construction began
The structural survey uncovered foundation problems in the building
Her survey of medieval literature spans three centuries

definitions: professional practice of determining terrestrial positions and boundaries of land through precise measurements
examples: Modern surveying uses GPS technology for accurate positioning
She studied surveying to become a licensed land surveyor

definitions: qualified professional who measures and maps land boundaries, elevations, and features for legal and construction purposes
examples: The surveyor marked the property corners with iron stakes
Marine surveyors inspect ships for insurance purposes

definitions: act or fact of continuing to live or exist despite dangerous or difficult circumstances
something that remains from an earlier time period or culture
examples: Their survival depended on finding fresh water sources
Cancer survival rates have improved with new treatments
This tradition is a survival from medieval times
The manuscript represents a rare survival from antiquity

definitions: person who actively prepares for emergencies or societal collapse through self-sufficiency skills and resource stockpiling
examples: The survivalist stored months of food supplies in his bunker
Survivalists practice wilderness skills like fire-starting and foraging

definitions: person who continues living after a dangerous event, illness, or difficult situation
object or structure that remains intact after destruction of similar things
examples: Cancer survivors shared their stories at the support group
The rescue team found three survivors in the wreckage
This building is the sole survivor of the historic district
The ancient statue is a remarkable survivor from Roman times

definitions: quality or state of being likely to be influenced, harmed, or affected by particular factors or conditions
examples: Genetic testing revealed her susceptibility to certain diseases
The material's susceptibility to corrosion limits outdoor applications

definitions: Japanese dish of vinegared rice combined with seafood, vegetables, and sometimes tropical fruits
examples: The restaurant serves fresh sushi prepared by trained chefs
She learned to make sushi rolls during her cooking class

definitions: person believed to be guilty of a crime or wrongdoing based on evidence or circumstances
examples: Police detained the suspect for questioning about the robbery
The prime suspect had an alibi for the night of the crime

definitions: feeling of excited or anxious uncertainty about what will happen in a situation or narrative
examples: The movie builds suspense through clever cinematography and music
Waiting for test results created unbearable suspense

definitions: temporary prevention from participating in an activity as punishment or precaution
system of springs and shock absorbers connecting wheels to vehicle chassis
state of being hung or held up from above by support
heterogeneous mixture where particles are dispersed throughout but not dissolved
examples: The player received a three-game suspension for unsportsmanlike conduct
School suspension rates have decreased with restorative justice programs
The car's suspension system provides a smooth ride over bumps
Off-road vehicles require heavy-duty suspension components
The bridge features cable suspension from massive towers
The sculpture creates an illusion of suspension in mid-air
Shake the medicine bottle to redistribute the suspension
Clay particles form a suspension in muddy water

definitions: feeling that something is possible, probable, or true without certain proof
very small amount or slight indication of something
examples: Her suspicion grew when he couldn't explain his whereabouts
The detective's suspicion led to uncovering the fraud
Add just a suspicion of garlic to the sauce
There was a suspicion of frost on the morning grass

definitions: ability to maintain ecological balance by avoiding depletion of natural resources and supporting long-term viability
examples: The company's sustainability initiatives reduced carbon emissions significantly
Urban planners prioritize sustainability in new development projects

definitions: person or thing that provides ongoing support, nourishment, or maintenance to sustain something
examples: God is viewed as the sustainer of life in many religions
The foundation serves as a major sustainer of arts programs

definitions: provision of logistics and personnel services required to maintain and prolong military operations
examples: Combat sustainment operations ensured continuous supply of ammunition
The army's sustainment brigade manages fuel and maintenance resources

definitions: food, drink, or other substances necessary for maintaining life and growth
examples: The hikers packed enough sustenance for three days
Many families struggle to afford basic sustenance

definitions: aphoristic scripture or collection of aphorisms in Hinduism and Buddhism containing religious teachings
examples: Buddhist monks study the Diamond Sutra for spiritual insight
The Yoga Sutras outline the eight limbs of yoga practice

definitions: thread or wire used to close wounds or surgical incisions by stitching
immovable junction between bones, especially in the skull where edges interlock
examples: The surgeon used dissolvable sutures to close the incision
The wound required twelve sutures after the accident
The cranial sutures fuse completely during early adulthood
Anthropologists examine skull sutures to estimate age

definitions: absorbent pad on a stick used for cleaning, applying substances, or collecting samples
sample of material collected using a swab for medical or forensic testing
examples: The nurse used a cotton swab to clean the wound
She applied the medication with a sterile swab
The DNA swab provided crucial evidence in the investigation
COVID testing requires a nasal swab for accurate results

definitions: ornamental festoon of flowers, fabric, or other material hung in a drooping curve
property obtained by theft or other illicit means
promotional merchandise or free goods distributed at events or by companies
examples: Wedding decorators hung swags of white fabric along the walls
The holiday swag featured pine branches and red ribbons
Police recovered the swag from the burglary in a warehouse
The thieves divided their swag after the heist
Conference attendees collected swag bags filled with branded items
Tech companies compete to offer the best swag at events

definitions: way of walking or moving with aggressive self-confidence or arrogance
ostentatiously confident or arrogant behavior, speech, or manner
examples: He entered the room with his characteristic swagger
The champion's swagger intimidated his opponents
His constant swagger annoyed his more modest colleagues
Behind the swagger was deep insecurity

definitions: young man who is a woman's lover or admirer, especially in poetry
young man from a rural or agricultural area, particularly a shepherd
examples: The maiden's swain wrote her romantic poetry
Multiple swains competed for her affection at the ball
The pastoral poem featured shepherds and swains
Young swains tended flocks in the countryside

definitions: small migratory songbird with long pointed wings and a forked tail
amount of food or liquid taken into the throat in one gulping motion
examples: Swallows return to the same nesting sites each spring
Barn swallows catch insects while flying
She took a large swallow of cold water
The medicine requires just one swallow

definitions: large colorful butterfly with distinctive tail-like extensions on hindwings
formal coat with two long tapering skirts at the back
examples: The yellow swallowtail butterfly visited the garden daily
Swallowtails are among the largest butterflies in North America
He wore a swallowtail coat to the formal dinner
The orchestra conductor's swallowtail flapped as he conducted

definitions: Hindu religious teacher or mystic, especially one who has taken vows of religious devotion
examples: The swami taught meditation techniques at the ashram
Many Western seekers studied with Indian swamis

definitions: area of low-lying land saturated with water, often dominated by woody vegetation
examples: Alligators inhabit the swamps of the southeastern United States
The cypress swamp provides habitat for diverse wildlife

definitions: extensive area of swampy ground typically unsuitable for cultivation without drainage
examples: Developers drained the swampland to build new housing
Protected swampland serves as crucial wildlife habitat

definitions: large waterbird with long curved neck, typically white plumage, known for grace and beauty
examples: Swans glided elegantly across the lake surface
The trumpeter swan is North America's largest waterfowl

definitions: behavior, appearance, or style that is ostentatiously stylish, expensive, or impressive
examples: The hotel's swank lobby impressed arriving guests
She carried herself with old Hollywood swank

definitions: act of exchanging one thing for another, especially by mutual agreement
examples: They arranged a swap of vacation homes for the summer
The currency swap helped both companies manage risk

definitions: large group of insects, especially bees, moving together
large number of people or things moving in a crowd or cluster
examples: A swarm of bees settled on the tree branch
The locust swarm devastated crops across the region
A swarm of reporters surrounded the celebrity
Tourists arrived in swarms during peak season

definitions: rush of seawater up the beach after the breaking of a wave
examples: The swash deposited shells and seaweed on the sand
Children played in the gentle swash at the water's edge

definitions: swaggering or daring soldier, adventurer, or swordsman, especially in historical fiction
examples: The movie featured a swashbuckler rescuing princesses
Classic swashbucklers like Errol Flynn defined the genre

definitions: characteristic of or befitting a swashbuckler; daring and romantic adventure
examples: His swashbuckling style made him a fan favorite
The novel featured swashbuckling pirates and hidden treasure

definitions: ancient symbol of a cross with arms bent at right angles, historically used in many cultures but now primarily associated with Nazism
examples: The swastika appears in ancient Hindu and Buddhist art
Nazi swastikas were removed from buildings after the war

definitions: special weapons and tactics police unit trained for dangerous operations
sharp slapping blow or the act of hitting with a quick motion
examples: The SWAT team responded to the hostage situation
SWAT officers train extensively in tactical operations
She gave the mosquito a quick swat
His swat sent the ball over the fence

definitions: small sample of fabric, paint, or other material used to demonstrate color, pattern, or texture
examples: The designer presented fabric swatches for the new collection
Paint swatches helped them choose the perfect wall color

definitions: strip of land from which grass or crops have been cut or mowed
broad strip, area, or range of something
examples: The mower left neat swaths across the hayfield
Each swath measured exactly six feet wide
The hurricane cut a swath of destruction through the coast
The policy affects a broad swath of the population

definitions: band of cloth or other material wrapped around something, especially for protection or support
examples: The nurse wrapped swathes of bandages around the injury
The baby was wrapped in soft swathes of cotton

definitions: rhythmic movement from side to side or back and forth
controlling power or influence over people's actions, opinions, or decisions
examples: The gentle sway of the hammock was relaxing
Trees showed a noticeable sway in the strong wind
The senator holds considerable sway over environmental policy
Public opinion holds little sway in authoritarian regimes

definitions: act of making a solemn declaration or taking an oath
use of offensive, blasphemous, or obscene language
examples: The swearing of the oath took place in the courthouse
Witness swearing ensures truthful testimony
Excessive swearing made the movie unsuitable for children
The coach's swearing earned him a technical foul

definitions: salty fluid secreted by glands in the skin to regulate body temperature
state of anxiety, effort, or hard physical work
examples: Sweat dripped from his forehead during the workout
Night sweats can indicate underlying health issues
Building the house required months of sweat and dedication
Don't sweat the small stuff
